title: Calories in Boba
meta_description: Discover calories in boba, including a standard serving's nutrition breakdown with carbs, sugars, fat, protein, and tips for lower-calorie tweaks.
assumptions: 16 oz serving of milk boba tea with black tea, whole milk, moderate sugar syrup, and cooked tapioca pearls; no extra toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shop, milk type, sweetness level, pearl portion, and add-ins. Check menus or apps for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 16 oz boba tea serving contains about 250 kcal, mostly from sugars and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a boba tea?
faqs.a: About 250 kcal for a standard 16 oz milk boba with moderate sugar and pearls.

faqs.q: Are boba calories mostly from sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, around 50 g sugars per serving, plus carbs from tapioca pearls.
Roughly 100 kcal for 1/4 cup cooked pearls; the drink base adds the rest.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in boba?

faqs.q: Is boba high in fat or protein?
faqs.a: Low protein (~2 g) and moderate fat (~5 g from milk); high carbs (~60 g).
